meanings.definition: Preoperative: relating to the period before a surgical operation
meanings.sent1: The preops instructions included fasting before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had a dedicated preops area for patients awaiting their procedures.
meanings.sent3: The preops checklist reminded the patient to remove jewelry before going into the operating room.
meanings.sent4: Her nerves were like preops butterflies fluttering in her stomach before the surgery.
meanings.sent5: The preops briefing made the upcoming operation seem more real and imminent.

meanings.definition: Preoperative: a patient who is preparing for surgery
meanings.sent1: The preops patient was given a hospital gown to change into.
meanings.sent2: The preops individuals were escorted to the pre-surgery waiting area.
meanings.sent3: The preops group chatted nervously while waiting for their turn in the operating room.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a preops soldier gearing up for battle before entering the surgical suite.
meanings.sent5: The preops group formed a bond as they shared their fears and hopes before the surgery.
